checkpoint.name: Blood storage has standardized procedure for transporting blood from parent blood bank.
Cold chain is maintained at all levels i.e. from parent blood bank to blood storage to the issue of blood.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: During transportation blood is properly packed in cold boxes surrounded by ice packs. Ice should not come in contact with blood bags.

checkpoint.name: Transfusion reaction form is provided when blood is issued
Any major or minor transfusion reaction is recorded and reported to responsible staff
Any major or minor transfusion reaction is recorded and reported at BSU
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: The event is communicated to Paediatrician Incharge as well as to the in charge of concern Blood storage unit.

checkpoint.name: Staff is competent to identify transfusion reaction and its management
Blood storage has system of detection, reporting and evaluations of transfusion errors
Any major or minor transfusion reaction is recorded and reported to responsible staff
Any major or minor transfusion reaction is recorded and reported to Blood Bank/Designated person
Availability of blood units in case of emergency with out replacement
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: The blood is ordered for the patient according to the MSBOS (Maximum Surgical Blood Order Schedule)

checkpoint.name: Blood storage has system to issue the blood along with cross matching report
Blood storage has procedure to issue the blood in case of its emergency requirement
Blood storage has system to retain recipient and donor blood sample for 7 days at specified temperature (2-8 c) after each transfusion
Blood storage has system to confirm that information on transfusion requisition form and recipients blood sample label is same
Blood storage has system to testing and cross matching the unit before issuing
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Testing of blood includes Determination ABO type, Rh (D) type, detection of unexpected antibodies etc.

checkpoint.name: Counselling provided for Post partum care
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Nutrition ,Contraception ,Breastfeeding ,Registration of Birth ,IFA Supplement ,Danger Signs.

checkpoint.name: Labour room has procedure to provide post partum Counselling
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Breast feeding and prevention of hypothermia

checkpoint.name: Counselling is done before discharge, Patient is explained about follow up visits
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Danger Sign for Mother: Bleeding, Pain abdomen, Severe Headache, Visual disturbance, Breathing difficulties, Fever and Chills, Difficulty in Urination, Foul smelling discharge. Danger sign for Baby: Fast & difficult breathing, Fever, Unusual Cold, Does not accept feed, Less active & yellow discoloration of skin

checkpoint.name: 48 Hour Stay of mothers and new born after delivery
Initiation of Breastfeeding with in 1 Hour
Prevention of Hypothermia of new born
Mother is monitored as per post natal care guideline
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for records of Uterine contraction, bleeding, temperature, B.P, pulse, Breast examination, (Nipple care, milk initiation)

checkpoint.name: Prevention of Hypothermia
Check for perennial washes performed
Post partum care of mother
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask mother about Checking uterine contraction, bleeding, checking for TPR and output chart, Breast examination and milk initiation and perineal washes

checkpoint.name: Post Partum Care of New-born
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Maintaining hand hygiene, keeps the baby wrapped (maintains temperature), Checks weight, temperature, respiration, heart rate, colour of skin and cord stump

checkpoint.name: Initiation of Breastfeeding with in one Hour
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Verify with mother regarding a)Counselling on Breast Feeding b)Time Period between delivery and first feed c)Advice in position of baby
